item.description:
Hi Everybody!

Join us today for a super breakfast / brunch at York Harbor Inn! Here is the link to York Harbor Inn:

http://www.yorkharbor...

....and here is the link to their great brunch menu!

http://www.yorkharbor...

After a great brunch / social, we will need to get some exercise, right? What better way to take care of that, than a hike in and around Mount Agamenticus! Here is the link to Mount A:

http://www.agamenticu...


We will drive to Mount A after brunch, a distance of about 9 miles (located about 6 miles from the York toll booths for those unfamiliar with the area).

We will hike about 3 miles (~ 1 1/2 hours) with the option for another hour or so for those who wish to join us for a longer hike.

For planning purposes, my best estimate for time is as follows:
10:30 - 12:00 - Brunch / Social
12:00 - 12:15 - Drive to Mount A
12:15 - 01:30 - 3 mile hike
01:30 - 02:30 - 2 mile additional optional hike

This is truly the best time of the year to enjoy these areas! As of now the forecast is for clear and seasonably cold (around 30 at the time of the hike).

Wear hiking shoes or boots with a sturdy grip on the bottom. Although not an issue at the moment, there can be some icy spots, so you may want to bring along some micro-spikes just in case and / or a hiking pole.

Last but not least - pack a thermos bottle of hot chocolate or coffee for the hike!

On the directions to York Harbor Inn, the directions are quite straightforward on the web site and Google Map. The Inn is located on Route 1A on the ocean. The only tricky spot is York Village: Bear right at the fork in York Village. Send me an e-mail if you need more detailed directions to York Harbor Inn.

Look forward to meeting you!
Randy
RandyS@maine.rr.com
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet inside. One of the doors is on the parking lot side of the building.

group.name: Trailblazers- A Seacoast Singles Meetup Group

item.name: Brunch and Hike on Sunday!
